commit.message: Bump version to v1.0.1-build.128 across multiple song index files and update package.json

Update song documentation and versioning

- Updated last modified dates and build versions in index.html files for songs 92 to 99.
- Updated package-lock.json and package.json to reflect new version 1.0.1-build.125 and updated dependencies.
- Added static serving of JSON data files for development in index.js.
- Enhanced service worker registration to detect GitHub Pages and adjust root path accordingly.
- Modified data-tables.ejs to dynamically set the data URL based on basePathPrefix.
chore(build): bump version to v1.0.1-build.119 and refresh generated docs/timestamps; fix(song-detail): load static JSON for static sites (remove API fallback)

chore(build): bump version to v1.0.1-build.118 and refresh generated docs/timestamps

- Update package.json version and refresh generated docs (footer build metadata, CSS bundle timestamp) across docs and song pages.
- Update .github/copilot-instructions.md to enforce GitHub Pages static-first guidance, robust URL parsing, checklist and API-fallback policy.
- Harden song-detail.js (src + docs): prefer static JSON, add clearer logging and validation, and fail-fast on invalid/missing static data (avoid automatic API fallback in production).

chore(build): bump version to v1.0.1-build.117 and refresh generated docs/timestamps

fix(github-pages): add /js-dev-env base path handling for data-table links and generated HTML
fix(song): robustly parse song id from nested URL paths in song-detail.js

docs: update .github/copilot-instructions.md and documentation to reflect new build layout, static site generation flow, and path conversion guidance

Add static Song Detail pages for multiple entries (songs #8, #9 and #80–#99)

- Add new static HTML pages: docs/song/{8,9,80..99}/index.html
- Provide a full, self-contained song detail template for each page:
  - Responsive layout with navbar, footer, SEO JSON-LD, favicon and PWA manifest
  - Hero header, statistics panel, description, tags, thumbnail and channel links
  - Loading and error states, "Back to All Songs" and Prev/Next navigation controls
- Client-side logic included per page (inline script, nonce="static-site-dummy-nonce"):
  - Fetch /api/song/:id and populate DOM elements with title, rank, channel, views, duration, followers, category, thumbnail, description and tags
  - Robust handling: HTTP status checks, loading→content toggle, show/hide blocks when data missing
  - Safe description/tags rendering via escapeHtml and link formatting (prevents XSS)
  - Prev/Next navigation logic bounded to ranks 1..100 and dynamic page title update
- Reference shared assets and utilities: /js-dev-env/css/*, dependencies.min.js, service-worker-register.js, theme-toggle/demo and component-library scripts
- Page metadata reflects build/version and last-updated information (v1.0.1-build.114, 11/3/2025)
- Purpose: provide ready-to-deploy static song detail pages that can be hydrated from /api/song endpoints for static-hosted documentation/site

No backend/API changes included; purely adds static front-end pages and client-side rendering logic.

chore(build): fallback to page.ejs if requested template missing; update docs and bump build metadata

- Add existence check in static site renderer and fall back to page.ejs when a requested template file is missing to prevent render errors.
- Expand documentation pages: add Advanced Components content, Data Tables feature/demo with toolbar and export controls, enhanced component navigation and interactive JS (tooltips, popovers, smooth scrolling, section observer).
- Update multiple generated docs footers and package version to v1.0.1-build.112.
- Refresh generated assets metadata (dependencies.css timestamp).

chore(build): remove unused depth param from static site generator and clean up test imports

- Remove unused `depth` parameter from convertPathsForGitHubPages and related `depth` variable/assignments in renderPage.
- Simplify call sites to no longer pass depth.
- Remove unused imports (version-manager, path) from build-info.test.js.

fix(github-pages): use /js-dev-env base path for assets, nav links, and service worker

- Update generate-static-site path conversion to prepend /js-dev-env/ for css, fonts,
  images, scripts, manifest, favicon and page links (handles GitHub Pages subdir).
- Replace relative paths in generated docs HTML with /js-dev-env/ absolute paths.
- Make service-worker registration compute site root dynamically and register
  service-worker from the site root (updated in src/public and docs JS).
- Bump package version and refresh generated CSS bundle timestamp in docs.
- Expand test coverage (api, build-info, version-manager, feature-management,
  performance-monitor) with additional cases to improve branch and edge-case testing.

fix(security): prevent command injection and XSS, use relative PWA paths, bump build metadata, add CodeQL config

- Replace execSync shell commands with spawnSync (avoid command injection) in build/maintenance scripts
- Escape user-supplied HTML in song detail and layout templates to mitigate XSS; add rel="noopener noreferrer" for external links
- Use relative ("./") paths for manifest, service worker and registration to support GitHub Pages subdirectory
- Update package version and docs build metadata/timestamps; refresh CSS bundle header
- Add CodeQL configuration to .github for security scanning
fix(maintenance): use correct src paths in security-audit script
fix(ci): use correct npm script names for security and SEO audits

chore: remove unused deps and silence lint warnings

- remove validator, cross-env and concat from package.json and package-lock
- update maintenance scripts to drop references to removed deps (optimize-dependencies, test-dependencies)
- simplify npm-audit-enhanced to avoid unused error vars and mark unused params
- call buildInfo.generateBuildInfo() without assigning unused value in static site generator
- replace unused catch params and local vars with unnamed catches/underscored vars (index, service-worker, tests)
- remove unused requires from feature-manager and feature-middleware
- tighten ESLint config: ignore build/artifacts, add common browser globals, and refine no-unused-vars handling

fix: add /songs/:id route alias for /song/:id

Both /song/:id and /songs/:id now work for song detail pages.
This provides better URL flexibility and user experience.

fix: add missing express-rate-limit import

The rate limiter was added to the YouTube songs endpoint but the
express-rate-limit module import was missing, causing a ReferenceError
at startup.

Fixed by adding: const rateLimit = require('express-rate-limit');

Server now starts successfully and rate limiting is functional.

fix: resolve Dependabot security alerts by removing unmaintained dependencies

Dependabot security fixes:
- Removed tableexport.jquery.plugin (unmaintained since 2020)
- Resolves Alert #66: SheetJS ReDoS (CVE-2024-22363) - HIGH severity
- Resolves Alert #65: SheetJS Prototype Pollution - HIGH severity
- No patched versions available via npm (package no longer maintained)

Impact:
- All npm audit vulnerabilities resolved (0 vulnerabilities found)
- Table export functionality (Excel/CSV) removed from application
- Bootstrap Table display functionality remains intact
- Security posture significantly improved

Changes:
- package.json: Removed tableexport.jquery.plugin dependency
- package.json: Removed xlsx overrides (no longer needed)
- build/build/bundle-javascript.js: Removed tableExport.min.js from bundle
- SECURITY-ALERTS.md: Updated with detailed removal documentation
- Rebuilt project without vulnerable dependencies

Bundle size reduction: 526KB -> 471KB (-55KB, -10.5%)

Alternative solutions documented in SECURITY-ALERTS.md for future consideration.
All Dependabot alerts will be automatically closed by GitHub.

fix: resolve GitHub code scanning security alerts

Security fixes implemented:
- Fixed polynomial regex (ReDoS) vulnerability in email validation (Alert #65)
- Added rate limiting to YouTube songs API endpoint (Alert #51)
- Fixed incomplete URL sanitization using proper URL parsing (Alerts #49, #50)
- Fixed bad HTML filtering regex in security-audit.js (Alert #54)

Third-party dependency mitigation:
- Created .gitattributes to mark generated files (linguist-generated)
- Added CodeQL config to exclude built/generated files from scanning
- Documented third-party library issues in SECURITY-ALERTS.md
- All issues in dependencies.js are from tableexport.jquery.plugin v1.33.0
- These files are auto-generated and should not be manually edited

Changes:
- src/index.js: Safer email regex, rate limiter, proper URL validation
- src/public/service-worker.js: Proper URL parsing instead of string matching
- build/maintenance/security-audit.js: More robust script tag detection
- .gitattributes: Mark generated files for GitHub
- .github/codeql-config.yml: Exclude generated files from scanning
- SECURITY-ALERTS.md: Complete security documentation

All source code issues resolved. Third-party issues documented and mitigated.
Refactor code structure for improved readability and maintainability

refactor: reorganize health check and plugin configuration

- Moved health check script to src/healthcheck.js and updated Dockerfile to reference the new path.
- Deleted outdated healthcheck.js and plugins.config.js files.
- Created a new plugins.config.js in src/config with updated plugin management paths.
- Updated references in the PluginManager to point to the new configuration file location.
- Updated version number in package.json and documentation files to reflect recent changes.

Add 404 error page, layout, and song detail templates with enhanced structure and styling

- Implemented a new 404 error page with user-friendly navigation options.
- Created a comprehensive layout template for consistent page structure across the application.
- Developed a detailed song information page with loading and error states, including dynamic content loading via JavaScript.
- Added partials for page header and footer to streamline content management and improve maintainability.
- Enhanced styling and responsiveness using Bootstrap components for better user experience.
update .gitignore

feat(navigation): restructure top navigation into logical groups with dropdowns

- Reorganized navigation from 8 items to 4 main categories: Documentation, Components, Community, and Theme Toggle.
- Implemented dropdown menus for better organization and user experience.
- Enhanced dropdown styling in SCSS for improved aesthetics and responsiveness.
- Updated layout.ejs to reflect new navigation structure and added Bootstrap dropdown functionality.
- Documented changes and future expansion possibilities in navigation restructure plan and implementation notes.

Implement comprehensive visibility fixes for song detail page across light and dark modes

- Added critical build process rules enforcement documentation to prevent inline CSS and manual file edits.
- Resolved hero section visibility issues by enhancing CSS specificity and ensuring proper contrast for text elements.
- Improved statistics section background contrast for both light and dark themes.
- Fixed no-thumbnail section visibility issues in dark mode.
- Enhanced general card content text visibility and link contrast in descriptions.
- Updated service worker to handle CSP violations and fetch errors effectively.
- Ensured all changes comply with build rules, maintaining a clean and responsive design.

feat: Add CSS and JavaScript bundling tools for improved asset management

- Implemented `bundle-css-dependencies.js` to bundle third-party CSS dependencies, including Bootstrap Table.
- Developed `bundle-javascript.js` for bundling JavaScript dependencies and custom scripts, with minification support.
- Created `data-tables.ejs` view to showcase YouTube Top 100 Songs with Bootstrap Table features, including sorting, searching, and exporting capabilities.
- Added `song-detail.ejs` view for displaying detailed information about individual songs, including statistics and navigation options.

Add comprehensive tests for performance and security utilities

- Implemented a suite of tests for the performance monitoring utility, covering middleware functionality, request tracking, metrics retrieval, and integration scenarios.
- Developed a complete set of tests for the security utility, including validation of trusted resources, SRI hash generation and verification, and adherence to security best practices.
- Ensured all tests validate expected behaviors, handle edge cases, and mock external dependencies appropriately.
chore: Update version numbers to v1.0.1-build.3 in documentation and package.json

feat: Add feature management CLI for managing feature flags and presets

- Implemented a command-line interface for feature management.
- Added commands for listing features, checking status, enabling/disabling features, and applying presets.
- Included help documentation for usage and examples.

feat: Introduce interactive setup wizard for project configuration

- Created an interactive setup wizard to guide users through project configuration.
- Users can select project type, features, development preferences, and deployment targets.
- Configuration is saved to a JSON file for future reference.

feat: Implement build information utility for tracking build metadata

- Added a utility to generate and manage build metadata.
- Includes methods for retrieving version info, build dates, and generating build info for static site generation.

feat: Create feature flag middleware for Express applications

- Developed middleware to expose feature flags to templates in Express.
- Allows checking of feature status and provides preset-specific feature configurations.

feat: Add performance monitoring utility for tracking build and runtime metrics

- Implemented a performance monitoring utility to analyze build performance and runtime metrics.
- Includes methods for recording metrics, analyzing file sizes, and generating performance reports.

feat: Introduce version management utility for automatic version incrementing

- Created a utility to handle version increments based on build counts.
- Supports major, minor, patch, and build version increments with updates to package.json.
feat: Enhance Docker build and CI/CD testing process with improved health checks and logging
fix: correct relative paths in security audit and project configuration scripts

feat: Upgrade Node.js version to 20 and enhance dependency installation process in CI/CD pipeline
feat: Add Node.js ES modules configuration to ESLint for better compatibility
fix: Update 'globals' package version in package-lock.json
refactor: Rename config variable in build configuration for clarity
refactor: Remove unused buildConfig import in build scripts

feat: Add development helper scripts for setup, testing, and deployment

- Implemented `dev-helper.js` for setting up the development environment, cleaning build artifacts, running tests, and deploying the application.
- Created `minimal-setup.js` to generate a simplified project structure for beginners, including essential files and configurations.
- Added `optimize-dependencies.js` to analyze and recommend dependency management strategies.
- Introduced `report-monthly.mjs` for generating monthly maintenance reports with placeholders for future implementation.
- Developed `security-audit.js` to validate external resource integrity and check for potential security issues in templates.
- Created `test-dependencies.js` to safely test and remove dependencies one by one, with detailed analysis and reporting.
- Added SEO and accessibility check scripts: `seo-a11y-checks.mjs`, `seo-validation-report.js`, and `ssl-expiry.ts` for monitoring SSL certificates and generating SEO reports.
- Included `.gitkeep` in the `seo` directory to maintain structure.

- Removed old backup file: package.json.backup.1753987914297
- Deleted unused mobile directory and its empty subdirectories
- Removed empty logs directory
- Cleaned up generated coverage reports
- Updated package.json dependencies to latest versions
- Verified all scripts in /scripts/ are actively used
- Ensured project structure remains organized and functional
refactor some scripts/docs
feat: add Advanced Components section and update navigation links in documentation

chore: update devDependencies and dependencies in package.json

- Added @parcel/watcher, @types/jest, cross-env, husky, lint-staged, and prettier to devDependencies.
- Updated jest from 30.0.4 to 30.0.5.
- Updated supertest from 7.1.3 to 7.1.4.
- Updated dotenv from 17.2.0 to 17.2.1.
- Updated express-rate-limit from 7.4.1 to 8.0.1.
- Updated uuid from 10.0.0 to 11.1.0.
- Updated validator from 13.12.0 to 13.15.15.

Fix: Improve GitHub Actions workflows and Docker configuration

- Remove redundant deploy.yml workflow (ci.yml already handles deployment)
- Update peaceiris/actions-gh-pages from v3 to v4 (latest version)
- Add timeout and cleanup steps to Docker container testing
- Remove deprecated 'version' field from docker-compose.yml
- Ensure proper container cleanup after testing to prevent resource leaks
- Streamline CI/CD pipeline for better maintainability

Fix: Update ESLint configuration and resolve linting errors

- Configure ESLint for different JavaScript environments (Node.js, browser, service worker)
- Add proper globals for browser files (document, window, localStorage, etc.)
- Add service worker globals (self, caches)
- Fix unused variable warnings in Node.js files
- Remove unused imports and parameters
- Add ignorePattern for standard Express middleware parameters (next)
- Ensure all JavaScript files pass linting in CI/CD pipeline
Fix: Update package-lock.json to sync with package.json dependencies
Implement feature X to enhance user experience and fix bug Y in module Z
Refactor code structure for improved readability and maintainability

feat: Add health check script for Docker containers

Add contributing and API reference pages, update navigation links

- Added "Contributing" and "API Reference" links to the navigation menus in community, components, getting started, and GitHub pages documentation.
- Created new "API Reference" and "Contributing" HTML pages with basic structure and content.
- Updated the "Open Command Prompt or PowerShell" instruction to "Open PowerShell (pwsh)" in the getting started guide.

feat: Enhance security and performance by implementing Content Security Policy (CSP) with nonce support

- Added nonce generation for CSP in Express middleware to allow inline scripts securely.
- Updated external resource links to use Subresource Integrity (SRI) for enhanced security.
- Removed inline service worker registration scripts and moved to dedicated JS files.
- Updated Highlight.js and Bootstrap versions for improved functionality and security.
- Added a security audit script to validate SRI hashes and check for potential security issues in templates.
- Refactored theme toggle functionality into a separate JS file for better organization and security.
chore: update jest to version 30.0.4 in package.json and package-lock.json

Add GitHub Pages deployment guide and navigation links

- Introduced a new page for GitHub Pages deployment guide with detailed steps for setting up and deploying an Express.js application.
- Updated navigation menus in community, components, and getting started sections to include a link to the new GitHub Pages guide.
- Enhanced the main index page to link to the GitHub Pages guide.

feat: Add initial documentation and static site generation scripts

- Added form-validation.js to enhance forms with Bootstrap 5 validation styles.
- Introduced theme-toggle.js for dark mode support with local storage preference.
- Developed service-worker.js for Progressive Web App (PWA) support and offline caching.
- Created manifest.json for PWA configuration.
- Added scripts for cleaning and copying static assets, and generating the static site from JSON data.
